summary: Experiment Pack 1 is a modder's resource containing furniture, trophies, display items, clutter and a large static library developed during the creation of The FPI Gallery for Console Decorators.
descriptionHtml:
=====================
Brief Description:
=====================

Experiment Pack 1 is a modder's resource containing furniture, trophies, display items, clutter and a large static library developed during the creation of The FPI Gallery for Console Decorators.

==================
Details:
==================

Experiment Pack 1 from the Fuzzy Physics Institute research labs contains approximately 350 items developed during the creation of The FPI Gallery for Console Decorators.

The majority of the items are from a large library of Bethesda assets that were turned to statics during that project. Had I had such a library available to me, it would have saved me many hours. Perhaps other new modders will benefit by not having to stop in the middle of doing something creative just because they need a static tomato or pitchfork. Perhaps even more experienced modders, who have already created their own libraries of statics, will find something that will save them a couple of minutes of hunting down a Bethesda asset and changing it.

The remainder of the items are unique static creations, including clutter items, a few pieces of furniture, variants on the standard bug jar, tabletop and wall display cases, trophies from Dawnguard and Dragonborn, food and tableware mashups, and a large collection of static banners with the textures and meshes tweaked to remove holes. Please see the additional documentation for some notes regarding the setup and usage of certain items in the Pack.

=========================
Installation (Manual):
=========================

1) Extract the contents of the archive to the Skyrim Data folder.
2) Use the assets in your projects.

============================
Un-Installation (Manual):
============================

1) Remove the assets from your projects.
2) Delete the files installed by Experiment Pack 1.

==================
Incompatible:
==================

None known

==================
Known Issues:
==================

None known

==================
Change log:
==================

2013.09.29 - Initial Release

2014.10.04 - Version 1.1 Release

    1) Restored missing mesh folder containing the mesh for the Baker's Table. Thanks to Aussie500 for pointing out the error.

    2) Optimized the model for the Noble Lectern Shelf to reduce the file size and improve the collision model.

==================
Contact Details:
==================

BrettM @ http://tesalliance.org.

==================
Credits:
==================

Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to WillieSea for the concept of the Baker's Table.
Thanks to the modding community at the TES Alliance for all-around goodness.

==================
Tools Used:
==================

Creation Kit
NifSkope
NifUtils Suite
PaintShop Pro X5
nvidia DDS plug-in
Blender
InsanitySorrow's ReadMe Generator

==================
Permissions:
==================

This file will be hosted at Skyrim Nexus and TESA. Do not upload to any other sites.

The assets may not be converted for other games.

You are free to use any asset or derivative in creating mods for players, provided that you credit me and no money is charged.

You are free to distribute any derivative asset made by filling empty jars or display cases as a new modder's resource, provided that you credit me and no money is charged.

Any other use of these assets or their derivatives requires my explicit permission.

==================
Modder's Will:
==================

If I am offline for six months or longer and do not respond to any attempts made at contacting me, I give full Ownership of this Project to TES Alliance.

TES Alliance are free to modify/redistribute/remove as they see fit.
author: The Fuzzy Physics Institute
